submission in paper of a Form&#160;6-K if submitted to furnish a report or other
document that the registrant foreign private issuer must furnish and make public
under the laws of the jurisdiction in which the registrant is incorporated, 
domiciled or legally organized (the registrant&#8217;s &#8220;home 
country&#8221;), or under the rules&#160;of the home country exchange on which 
the registrant&#8217;s securities are traded, as long as the report or other 
document is not a press release, is not required to be and has not been 
distributed to the registrant&#8217;s security holders, and, if discussing a 
material event, has already been the subject of a Form&#160;6-K submission or 
other Commission filing on EDGAR.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-

<a name="sFF21BA3ACCCB14E176B6B4AA4505F4A0"></a><div></div><br><div style="line-
height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;text-align:justify;font-size:9pt;"><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-weight:bold;text-
decoration:underline;">MANAGEMENT&#8217;S DISCUSSION AND 
ANALYSIS</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;text-
align:justify;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">This management&#8217;s discussion and analysis 
(&#8220;MD&amp;A&#8221;) of ARC Resources Ltd. (&#8220;ARC&#8221; or the 
&#8220;Company&#8221;) is Management&#8217;s analysis of the financial 
performance and significant trends or external factors that may affect future 
performance. It is dated </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">July&#160;30, 2014</font><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;and should be read in conjunction 
with the unaudited condensed interim consolidated financial statements (the 
"financial statements") as at and for the </font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">three and six months ended</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">June 30, 2014</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">, 
and the MD&amp;A and audited consolidated financial statements as at and for the
year ended December 31, 2013, as well as ARC&#8217;s Annual Information Form
that is filed on SEDAR at </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;text-decoration:underline;">www.sedar.com</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">. All financial information is reported in Canadian
dollars, unless otherwise noted.</font></div><div style="line-
height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;text-align:justify;font-size:9pt;"><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">This MD&amp;A contains additional 
generally accepted accounting principles ("GAAP") measures, non-GAAP measures 
and forward-looking statements. Readers are cautioned that the MD&amp;A should 
be read in conjunction with ARC&#8217;s disclosure under the headings 
&#8220;Non-GAAP Measures,&#8221; &#8220;Additional GAAP Measures,&#8221; 
&#8220;Forward-looking Information and Statements&#8221; and "Glossary" included
at the end of this MD&amp;A.</font></div><a 
name="s0E17CB200AA5CC0033D9B4AA4524436D"></a><div style="line-
height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;text-align:justify;font-
size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-weight:bold;">ABOUT
ARC RESOURCES LTD.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-
bottom:10px;text-align:justify;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">ARC is a dividend</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-weight:bold;">-</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">paying Canadian oil and gas company with near-term 
and long-term oil, natural gas, condensate and NGLs growth prospects 
headquartered in Calgary, Alberta. ARC&#8217;s activities relate to the 
exploration, development and production of conventional oil and natural gas in 
Canada with an emphasis on the acquisition and development of properties with a 
large volume of hydrocarbons in place commonly referred to as &#8220;resource 
plays.&#8221;</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;text-
align:justify;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">ARC&#8217;s vision is to be a leading energy producer, focused on 
delivering results through its strategy of </font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-weight:bold;">risk-managed value 
creation</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">.</font><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-weight:bold;">&#32;</font><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">ARC is committed to providing superior 
long-term financial returns for its shareholders, creating a culture where 
respect for the individual is paramount and action and passion are rewarded, and
running its business in a manner that protects the safety of employees, 
communities and the environment. ARC&#8217;s vision is realized through the four
pillars of its strategy:</font></div><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" 
style="padding-bottom:10px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td
style="width:48px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div 
style="line-height:120%;font-size:9pt;padding-left:24px;"><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">1.</font></div></td><td style="vertical-
align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-
size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-weight:bold;">High 
quality, long-life assets</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">&#32;&#8211; ARC&#8217;s unique suite of assets include both growth 
and base assets. ARC&#8217;s growth assets consist of world-class resource play 
properties, primarily concentrated in the Montney geological formation in 
northeast British Columbia and northern Alberta, and the Cardium formation in 
the Pembina area of Alberta. These assets provide substantial growth 
opportunities, which ARC will pursue with a clear line of sight towards long-
term profitable development. ARC&#8217;s base assets consist of core properties 
located throughout Alberta, Saskatchewan and Manitoba. The base assets deliver 
stable production and contribute significant cash flows to fund future 
growth.</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" 
style="padding-bottom:10px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td
style="width:48px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div 
style="line-height:120%;font-size:9pt;padding-left:24px;"><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">2.</font></div></td><td style="vertical-
align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-
size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-
weight:bold;">Operational excellence</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">&#32;&#8211; ARC is focused on capital discipline and cost management
to extract the maximum return on its investments while operating in a safe and
environmentally responsible manner. Production from individual oil and natural 
gas wells naturally declines over time. In any one year, ARC approves a budget 
to drill new wells with the intent to first replace production declines and 
second to potentially increase production volumes. At times, ARC may also 
acquire strategic producing or undeveloped properties to enhance current 
production and reserves or to provide potential future drilling locations. 
Alternatively, it may strategically dispose of non-core assets that no longer 
meet its investment criteria.</font></div></td></tr></table><table 
cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-bottom:10px;font-family:Times New
Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:48px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td 
style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:9pt;padding-
left:24px;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">3.</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-
height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-weight:bold;">Financial flexibility </font><font
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#8211;</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-weight:bold;">&#32;</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">ARC provides returns to shareholders through a 
combination of a monthly dividend, currently $0.10 per share per month, and a 
potential for capital appreciation. ARC&#8217;s goal is to fund capital 
expenditures necessary to replace production declines and dividend payments 
using funds from operations </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:8pt;"><sup style="vertical-align:top;line-height:120%;font-
size:5pt">(1)</sup></font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">. ARC 
will finance growth activities through a combination of sources including funds 
from operations, proceeds from ARC&#8217;s Dividend Reinvestment Program 
(&#8220;DRIP&#8221;), reduced funding required under the Stock Dividend Program 
("SDP"), proceeds from property dispositions, debt capacity, and if necessary, 
equity issuance. ARC chooses to maintain prudent debt levels, targeting its net 
debt</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"><sup style="vertical-
align:top;line-height:120%;font-size:6pt"> </sup></font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">to be one to 1.5 times annualized funds from 
operations and less than 20 per cent of total capitalization</font><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"><sup style="vertical-align:top;line-
height:120%;font-size:6pt"> </sup></font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">over the long-term </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:8pt;"><sup style="vertical-align:top;line-height:120%;font-
size:5pt">(1)</sup></font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">.</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" 
cellspacing="0" style="padding-bottom:10px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-
size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:48px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td 
style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:9pt;padding-
left:24px;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">4.</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-
height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-weight:bold;">Top talent and strong leadership 
culture</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;&#8211; ARC is
committed to the attraction, retention and development of the best and brightest
people within its organization. ARC&#8217;s employees conduct business every day
in a culture of trust, respect, integrity and accountability. Building 
leadership talent
 at all levels of the organization is a key focus. ARC is also</font><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;committed to corporate leadership 
through community investment, environmental reporting practices and open 
communication with all stakeholders. As of the end of </font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">June 
2014</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">, ARC had 
approximately 585 employees with 344 professional, technical and support staff 
in the Calgary office, and 241 individuals located across ARC&#8217;s operating 
ar</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">eas in western 
Canada.</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" 
style="padding-bottom:10px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td
style="width:18px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div 
style="line-height:120%;font-size:6pt;padding-left:0px;"><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:6pt;">(1)</font></div></td><td style="vertical-
align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-
size:6pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:6pt;color:#000000;text-
decoration:none;">Funds from operations, net debt, and total capitalization are 
additional GAAP measures which may not be comparable to similar additional GAAP 
measures used by other entities. Refer to the section entitled &#8220;Additional
GAAP Measures&#8221; contained within this MD&amp;A. Also refer to the "Funds 
from Operations" section within this MD&amp;A for a reconciliation of 
ARC&#8217;s net income to funds from operations and cash flow from operating 
activities.</font></div></td></tr></table><br><div><div style="line-

align:bottom;border-bottom:2px solid #000000;"><div style="text-align:left;font-

size:8pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:8pt;">8</font></div></td></tr></table></div></div><table cellpadding="0" 
cellspacing="0" style="font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td 
style="width:18px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div 
style="line-height:120%;font-size:8pt;padding-left:0px;"><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:8pt;">(1)</font></div></td><td style="vertical-
align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-
size:8pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;color:#000000;font-
style:normal;font-weight:normal;text-decoration:none;">The benchmark prices do 
not reflect ARC's realized sales prices. For average realized sales prices, 
refer to Table 13 in this MD&amp;A. Prices and exchange rates presented above 
represent averages for the respective 
periods.</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" 
style="padding-bottom:10px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td
style="width:18px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div 
style="line-height:120%;font-size:8pt;padding-left:0px;"><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:8pt;">(2)</font></div></td><td style="vertical-
align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-
size:8pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;">NYMEX Henry Hub "Last 
Day" Settlement.</font></div></td></tr></table><div style="line-
height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;text-align:justify;font-size:9pt;"><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;text-
decoration:none;">Global crude oil prices remained strong through the second 
quarter of 2014 as a result of support from increased demand. WTI crude oil 
prices averaged US$102.98 per barrel during the second quarter of 2014, nine per
cent higher than the </font></div><br><div><div style="line-height:120%;text-
align:center;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-
size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-
align:center;font-size:10pt;"><div style="padding-left:0px;text-indent:0px;line-
height:normal;padding-top:10px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" 
style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;margin-left:auto;margin-
right:auto;width:91.40625%;border-collapse:collapse;text-align:left;"><tr><td 
colspan="3"></td></tr><tr><td width="34%"></td><td width="33%"></td><td 
width="33%"></td></tr><tr><td colspan="2" style="vertical-align:bottom;padding-
left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;border-top:1px 
solid #000000;"><div style="text-align:left;font-size:7pt;"><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:7pt;">ARC Resources Ltd.</font></div></td><td
style="vertical-align:bottom;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-
bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;border-top:1px solid #000000;"><div style="text-
align:right;font-size:7pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:7pt;">Page 
2</font></div></td></tr></table></div></div></div><hr style="page-break-
after:always"><div></div><br><div style="line-height:120%;padding-
bottom:10px;text-align:justify;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">second quarter 
of 2013. Brent crude oil prices remained strong throughout the second quarter on
expected growth in global crude oil demand and ongoing geopolitical uncertainty.
The benchmark Canadian light crude oil price, Edmonton Par, averaged $105.62 per
barrel in the second quarter of 2014, 14 per cent higher than the second quarter
of 2013. The WTI/Edmonton Par differential averaged a discount of US$6.13 per 
barrel during the second quarter of 2014. As compared to 2013, the volatility 
associated with Canadian crude oil differentials during the first half of 2014 
was less significant due to commissioning of certain pipeline and infrastructure
projects and strong refinery utilization. Additional pipeline and infrastructure
projects and increased crude oil rail capacity are anticipated in 2014, and are 
expected to further alleviate certain bottlenecks. However, in the near-term, 
crude oil differentials may experience continued volatility until additional 
infrastructure capacity is available to meet the growing North American 
production level.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-
bottom:10px;text-align:justify;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">North American 
natural gas prices increased substantially in 2014 with the second quarter NYMEX
Henry Hub (&#8220;NYMEX&#8221;) and AECO monthly (&#8220;AECO&#8221;) prices 
approximately 14 per cent and 30 per cent higher than second quarter 2013 
levels, respectively. While ARC's diversified sales portfolio provides price 
exposure to a variety of markets, ARC's realized price on natural gas is 
primarily referenced to the AECO Hub. The AECO/NYMEX differential narrowed 
significantly in the first quarter of 2014 due to a prolonged cold winter that 
resulted in high western Canadian exports to the US and record intra-Alberta 
demand. As a result, Alberta natural gas inventories were drawn down to multi-
year lows. Despite record North American natural gas production, natural gas 
inventories remained at low levels through the second quarter, therefore 
supporting domestic natural gas prices. Over the long-term, ARC expects demand 
for natural gas to increase due to the potential export of liquefied natural 
gas, increased natural gas power generation, increased exports to Mexico, and 
increased usage from the transportation and industrial sectors.</font></div><div
style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;text-align:justify;font-
size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;text-
decoration:none;">The devaluation of the Canadian dollar relative to the US 
dollar, which started in 2013 and continued through the first half of 2014, was 
attributed to a strengthening of the US economy relative to the Canadian 
economy. In particular, higher growth and employment rates in the US resulted in
easing of the Federal Reserve&#8217;s financial stimulus program. Given that 
North American crude oil and natural gas benchmark prices are denominated in US 
dollars, the strengthening of the US dollar has a positive impact on the 
revenues received by western Canadian
 producers. Movement in the Cdn$/US$ exchange rate also impacts the value of 
ARC's long-term debt given that approximately 79 per cent of ARC's total debt 
outstanding is denominated in US dollars.</font></div><div style="line-
height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;text-align:justify;font-size:9pt;"><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;text-
decoration:none;">Ongoing commodity price volatility may affect ARC's funds from
operations and rates of return on its capital programs. As continued volatility 
is expected in 2014, ARC will take steps to mitigate these risks and protect its
strong financial position.</font></div><br><div><div style="line-
height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-
family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-
height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:10pt;"><div style="padding-
left:0px;text-indent:0px;line-height:normal;padding-top:10px;"><table 
cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-
size:10pt;margin-left:auto;margin-right:auto;width:91.40625%;border-
collapse:collapse;text-align:left;"><tr><td colspan="3"></td></tr><tr><td
width="34%"></td><td width="33%"></td><td width="33%"></td></tr><tr><td 
colspan="2" style="vertical-align:bottom;padding-left:2px;padding-

associated with ARC&#8217;s long-term incentive plans. Actual per boe costs for 
each of these components for the </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-

style="font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;">&#32;</font><font style="font-

cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-family:Times New Roman; font-

above.</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" 
style="padding-bottom:10px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td

style="line-height:120%;font-size:8pt;padding-left:0px;"><font style="font-

</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;color:#000000;font-
style:normal;font-weight:normal;text-decoration:none;">$47 million</font><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;">&#32;for the </font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:8pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">six months 
ended</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;">&#32;</font><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">June
30, 2014</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;">&#32;reflects a 
prorated estimate of the 2014 annual cash tax obligation based on commodity 
prices received to date and the outlook for commodity prices for the remainder 
of 2014.</font></div></td></tr></table><div style="line-height:120%;padding-
bottom:10px;text-align:justify;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">ARC&#8217;s year-to-date 2014 production was 
</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">107,944</font><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;boe per day. This is below the 
annual guidance range as new wells were systematically brought on production 
during the first half of the year. ARC expects 2014 annual average production to
be within the guidance range of 110,000 to 114,000 boe per day despite its 
disposition of properties producing approximately 2,400 boe per day early in the
second quarter.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-
bottom:10px;text-align:justify;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">On a per boe basis, operating expenses were below 
the guidance range during the first half of 2014, as ARC continues to increase 
its production from properties with lower operating cost structures. 
Transportation expense has exceeded original guidance during the first six 
months of 2014 as ARC continues to incur additional trucking and pipeline 
charges as a result of taking ownership of its marketing arrangements. G&amp;A 
expenses were below guidance during the first half of 2014 reflecting a 
reduction to the estimated payment obligation under ARC's long-term incentive 
plans at June 30, 2014.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-
bottom:10px;text-align:justify;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">The guidance information presented herein is 
intended to provide shareholders with information on Management&#8217;s 
expectations for results of operations. Readers are cautioned that the guidance 
may not be appropriate for other purposes.</font></div><br><div><div

align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-
size:8pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;text-
transform:default;">ARC enters into certain commodity price risk management 
contracts that pertain to production periods spanning the entire calendar year 
but that are settled at the end of the year on an annual average benchmark 
commodity price.</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:8pt;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;text-
transform:default;">The portion of gains or losses associated with these 
contracts that relate to production periods for the three and six months ended 
June 30 has been applied to either increase or reduce funds from operations and 
operating income in order to more appropriately reflect the funds from 
operations and operating income generated during the period after any effect of 
contracts used for economic hedging.</font></div></td></tr></table><div 
style="line-height:120%;padding-left:18px;font-size:8pt;"><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:8pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-
height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;text-align:justify;font-size:9pt;"><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">Funds from operations </font><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">increase</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">d by </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">47</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;per cent
in the </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;text-
decoration:none;">second</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">&#32;quarter of </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">2014</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;to </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">$295.8 million</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">&#32;from </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">$201.2 million</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">&#32;generated in the </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">second</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;quarter of </font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">2013</font><font
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">. The increase reflects increased 
revenue associated with higher realized commodity prices as well as increased 
crude oil and liquids and natural gas production and modestly reduced G&amp;A 
costs. Increased royalties, increased realized losses on risk management 
contracts, higher current taxes, and higher operating and transportation 
expenses served to offset the increase in funds from 
operations.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;text-
align:justify;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">For
the first </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">six</font><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;months of </font><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;text-
decoration:none;">2014</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">,
funds from operations </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">increase</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">d by 
</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">$184.5 million</font><font
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;or </font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">46</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">&#32;per cent as compared to the same period in </font><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;text-
decoration:none;">2013</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">. 
Increased commodity prices alongside increased crude oil, natural gas and NGLs 
volumes and reduced G&amp;A expenses contributed to the year-over-year increase 
in funds from operations, offset by increased realized losses on risk management
contracts and increased royalties, current income taxes, transportation, and 
operating expenses.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-
bottom:10px;text-align:justify;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"><br></font></div><br><div><div style="line-

size:9pt;">&#32;quarter of </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">2013</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">. While ARC recorded increased revenue net of 
royalties of $142.8 million, this increase was partially offset by increased
losses on risk management contracts of $72.7 million reflecting the impact of 
stronger current commodity prices and higher expected future commodity prices. 
Higher production levels served to increase ARC's transportation, operating, and
DD&amp;A charges by $3 million, $3.8 million and $30.7 million, respectively, 
while increased foreign exchange gains of $50.6 million were experienced as a 
result of the revaluation of ARC's US dollar denominated debt outstanding from 
the period of March&#160;31, 2014 to June 30, 2014. During the three months 
ended June 30, 2013, ARC recorded a gain on its disposal of non-core assets of 
$17 million, where in 2014 no such gains were recognized.</font></div><div 
style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;text-align:justify;font-
size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">For the </font><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">six months ended</font><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">June 30, 2014</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">, net income was </font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">$176.8 million</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;(</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">$0.56</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;per 
share) as compared to </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">$140.2 million</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">&#32;(</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">$0.45</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;per 
share) in </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">2013</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;resulting in a year-over-year </font><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">increase</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;of </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">$36.6 million</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">. 
Revenue after royalties increased by $283.9 million for the six months ended 
June 30,2014 as compared to the same period in 2013, but was partially offset by
increased losses on risk management contracts of $183.3 million. Consistent with
the quarterly analysis above, ARC recognized increased transportation, 
operating, and DD&amp;A expenses of $9 million, $14.4 million and $47.3 million,
respectively, during the six months ended June 30, 2014 as compared to the six 
months ended June 30, 2013 as a result of increased production levels. Reduced 
G&amp;A expenses of $12.3 million and reduced losses on foreign exchange of 
$36.9 million served to increase net income, offset by a $34.4 million gain on 
disposal that was recorded during the first six months of 2013 when no such gain
was recorded during the same period of the current year.</font></div><div 
style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;text-align:justify;font-
size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;"><br></font></div><br><div><div style="line-height:120%;text-
align:center;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-
size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-
align:center;font-size:10pt;"><div style="padding-left:0px;text-indent:0px;line-
height:normal;padding-top:10px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" 
style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;margin-left:auto;margin-
right:auto;width:91.40625%;border-collapse:collapse;text-align:left;"><tr><td
 colspan="3"></td></tr><tr><td width="34%"></td><td width="33%"></td><td 
width="33%"></td></tr><tr><td colspan="2" style="vertical-align:bottom;padding-
left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;border-top:1px 
solid #000000;"><div style="text-align:left;font-size:7pt;"><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:7pt;">ARC Resources Ltd.</font></div></td><td 
style="vertical-align:bottom;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-
bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;border-top:1px solid #000000;"><div style="text-
align:right;font-size:7pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:7pt;">Page 
7</font></div></td></tr></table></div></div></div><hr style="page-break-
after:always"><a 
name="sCBE7AE5017BDC6511937B4AA3DA5BCD3"></a><div></div><br><div style="line-
height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;text-align:left;font-size:9pt;"><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-weight:bold;">Operating 
Income</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;text-
align:justify;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">Operating income is a non-GAAP financial measure that does not have
standardized meaning, and is therefore unlikely to be comparable to similar 
measures presented by other issuers. Operating income is defined by ARC as net 
income excluding the impact of after-tax unrealized gains and losses on risk 
management contracts, after-tax unrealized gains and losses on foreign exchange,
after-tax gains on disposal of petroleum and natural gas properties, after-tax 
impairment on PP&amp;E, after-tax unrealized gains and losses on short-term 
investments, and is further adjusted to include any after-tax portion of 
unrealized gains or losses on risk management contracts settled annually that 
relate to current period production. ARC believes that adjusting net income for 
these non-operating items presents a measure of &#8220;full cycle&#8221; 
financial performance that is more comparable between periods than net income. 
The most directly comparable GAAP measure to operating income is net income. 
Refer to the section entitled "Non-GAAP Measures" at the end of this 
MD&amp;A.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;text-
align:justify;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">ARC's operating income was </font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">$116.9 million</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;in the </font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">second</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">&#32;quarter of </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">2014</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">, 
</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">up</font><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">$63 million</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;compared to operating income of </font><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">$53.9 million</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;in the </font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">second</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">&#32;quarter of </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">2013</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">. For the </font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">six months ended</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">June 30, 2014</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">, 
operating income was </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">$233.9 million</font><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">, </font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">up</font><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">$132.3 
million</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;from 
</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;text-
decoration:none;">$101.6 million</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">&#32;from the same period in </font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">2013</font><font
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">.</font></div><div style="line-
height:120%;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;color:#000000;font-weight:bold;text-decoration:none;">Table 
9</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-
weight:bold;">&#32;</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-

height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;text-align:justify;padding-left:18px;text-
indent:-18px;font-size:8pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;">(1) 
</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;">ARC enters into certain
commodity price risk management contracts that pertain to production periods 
spanning the entire calendar year but that are settled at the end of the year on
an annual average benchmark commodity price.</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:8pt;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:8pt;">The portion of gains or losses associated with these contracts that 
relate to production periods for the three and six months ended June 30 has been
applied to either increase or reduce funds from operations and operating income 
in order to more appropriately reflect the funds from operations and operating 
income generated during the period after any effect of contracts used for 
economic hedging.</font></div><a 
name="sAE6C8A30AA11F44BE76BB4AA3D093580"></a><div style="line-
height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;text-align:justify;font-size:9pt;"><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-
weight:bold;">Production</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-
bottom:10px;text-align:justify;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">Production
 volumes averaged </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">110,165</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;boe
per day in the </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">second</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">&#32;quarter of </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">2014</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">, an 
</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">18</font><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;per cent </font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">increase</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">&#32;compared to an average of </font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">93,436</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">&#32;boe per day for the same period in </font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">2013</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">. The increase in volumes is attributed to new production from wells 
brought on stream in late 2013 and through 2014, partially offset by the 
disposal of non-core assets early in the second quarter producing approximately 
2,400 boe per day.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-
bottom:10px;text-align:justify;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">During the </font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">six months ended</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">June 30, 2014</font><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">, production volumes averaged 
</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">107,944</font><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;boe per day, a </font><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">14</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;per cent </font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">increase</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">&#32;from production of </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">94,449</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;boe 
per day for the same period in the prior year, also attributed to good 
operational run-time and new production brought on from wells drilled in 2013 
and 2014, offset slightly by the loss of production from the disposition of non-
core assets.</font></div><br><div><div style="line-height:120%;text-

style="vertical-align:bottom;border-bottom:2px solid #000000;background-
color:#cceeff;"><div style="text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-
family:inherit;font-
size:10pt;"><br></font></div></td></tr></table></div></div><div style="line-
height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;text-align:justify;font-size:9pt;"><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">ARC&#8217;s crude oil production
consists predominantly of light and medium crude oil while heavy oil accounts 
for approximately </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">three</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;per 
cent of total oil production. During the </font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;text-
decoration:none;">second</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">&#32;quarter of </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">2014</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">, crude oil and liquids production </font><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">increase</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">d </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">20</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;per cent
from the </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;text-
decoration:none;">second</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">&#32;quarter of the prior year. Increased crude oil and liquids 
production is mainly the result of positive drilling results from new wells in 
Parkland and Tower in northeastern British Columbia and Ante Creek in northern 
Alberta. The increases were partially offset by approximately 500 barrels per 
day of production downtime associated with turnaround and pipeline integrity 
maintenance at Redwater.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-
bottom:10px;text-align:justify;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">For the </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">six months ended</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">June 30, 
2014</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">, ARC's total oil 
production </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">increase</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">d by 
</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">4,324</font><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;barrels per day or </font><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">13</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;per cent as compared to the same period in 
</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;text-
decoration:none;">2013</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">, 
also a result of new wells drilled throughout 2013.</font></div><div 
style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;text-align:justify;font-
size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">Natural gas production
was </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">397.2</font><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;mmcf per day in the </font><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;text-
decoration:none;">second</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">&#32;quarter of </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">2014</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">, an </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">increase</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;of
</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">17</font><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;per cent from the </font><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">340.8</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;mmcf per day produced in the </font><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;text-
decoration:none;">second</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">&#32;quarter of </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">2013</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">. The increase is mainly attributed to new wells in
Parkland, Sunrise and Attachie in northeastern British Columbia and is partially
offset by the disposition of non-core assets early in the second quarter of 
2014.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;text-
align:justify;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">ARC
produced </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">383.5</font><font
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;mmcf per day of natural gas during
the </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">six months 
ended</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;</font><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">June 30, 2014</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">, an </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">11</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;per cent
</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">increase</font><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;from the same period of the prior 
year, reflecting new wells drilled in northeastern British 
Columbia.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;text-
align:justify;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">During the </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">second</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;quarter of </font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">2014</font><font
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">, ARC drilled </font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">37</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">&#32;gross wells (</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">37</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;net 
wells) on operated properties consisting of </font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">18</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">&#32;gross (</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">18</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;net) oil
wells, </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">12</font><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;gross (</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">12</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">&#32;net) natural gas wells, and </font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">seven</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">&#32;gross (</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">seven</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;net) 
liquids-rich natural gas wells. Total wells drilled to </font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">June 30, 2014</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;were </font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">97</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">&#32;gross wells (</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">94</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;net 
wells) on operated properties consisting of </font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">61</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">&#32;gross (</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">58</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;net) oil
wells, </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">20</font><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;gross (</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">20</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">&#32;net) natural gas wells, and </font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">16</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">&#32;gross (</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">16</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;net) 
liquids-rich natural gas wells.</font></div><br><div><div style="line-

name="sC468B392D01D24C67E7BB4AA3DA58551"></a><div></div><br><div style="line-
height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;text-align:left;font-size:9pt;"><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-weight:bold;">Sales of Crude Oil, 
Natural Gas, Condensate, NGLs and Other Income</font></div><div style="line-
height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;text-align:justify;font-size:9pt;"><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">Sales revenue from crude oil, natural 
gas, condensate, NGLs and other income was </font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">$567 million</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;in the </font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;text-
decoration:none;">second</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">&#32;quarter of </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">2014</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">, </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">an increase</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">&#32;of </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">$163.6 
million</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;from 
</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">$403.4 million</font><font
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;for the same period in the prior 
year, reflecting </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">an 
increase</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;in pricing 
which contributed additional revenue of </font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">$87.2 million</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;and </font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">increase</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">d production volumes that contributed an additional </font><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">$76.4 million</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">. Crude oil, condensate and NGLs revenue accounted 
for </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">$385.3 
million</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;or 
</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">68</font><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;per cent of </font><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;text-
decoration:none;">second</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">&#32;quarter sales revenue.</font></div><div style="line-
height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;text-align:justify;font-size:9pt;"><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">For the </font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">six months ended</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">June 30, 2014</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">, 
sales revenue from crude oil, natural gas, condensate, NGLs and other income was
</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;text-
decoration:none;">$1,118.4 million</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">, </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">an 
increase</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;of 
</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">$336.5 million</font><font
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;from </font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">$781.9 
million</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;for the same 
period in the prior year, reflecting </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">an increase</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">&#32;in pricing which contributed additional revenue of </font><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">$205.4 million</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;and </font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">increase</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">d production volumes that contributed an additional </font><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">$131.1 million</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">.</font></div><div
 style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;text-align:justify;font-

Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:18px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td 
style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:8pt;padding-

size:8pt;">(1)</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div 
style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;font-size:8pt;"><font style="font-

index.</font></div></td></tr></table><div style="line-height:120%;padding-
bottom:10px;text-align:justify;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">In the </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">second</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;quarter of </font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">2014</font><font
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">, WTI (US$/bbl) </font><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">increase</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">d </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">nine</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;per 
cent year-over-year while</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;font-weight:bold;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">ARC&#8217;s realized crude oil price </font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">increase</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">d by </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">15</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;per cent
during the same time period. Partially offsetting the increase in the WTI 
benchmark price, the differential between WTI and Edmonton posted prices widened
to an average discount of US$6.13 per barrel in the second quarter of 2014 from 
US$3.64 per barrel in the same period in 2013. However, during the same period, 
the </font></div><br><div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-
size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-
size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-
align:center;font-size:10pt;"><div style="padding-left:0px;text-indent:0px;line-
height:normal;padding-top:10px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" 
style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;margin-left:auto;margin-
right:auto;width:91.40625%;border-collapse:collapse;text-align:left;"><tr><td 
colspan="3"></td></tr><tr><td width="34%"></td><td width="33%"></td><td 
width="33%"></td></tr><tr><td colspan="2" style="vertical-align:bottom;padding-
left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;border-top:1px 
solid #000000;"><div style="text-align:left;font-size:7pt;"><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:7pt;">ARC Resources Ltd.</font></div></td><td 
style="vertical-align:bottom;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-
bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;border-top:1px solid #000000;"><div style="text-
align:right;font-size:7pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:7pt;">Page 
11</font></div></td></tr></table></div></div></div><hr style="page-break-
after:always"><a 
name="sC468B392D01D24C67E7BB4AA3DA58551"></a><div></div><br><div style="line-
height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;text-align:justify;font-size:9pt;"><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">average exchange rate for the Canadian 
dollar as compared to the US dollar weakened from $1.02 to $1.09. As a result of
these factors, ARC's realized crude oil price has increased by 15 per cent from 
$89.18 per barrel during the second quarter of 2013 to $102.14 during the second
quarter of 2014.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-
bottom:10px;text-align:justify;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">ARC's average realized oil price for the 
</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">six</font><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;months ended </font><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">June 30, 2014</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;of </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">$98.78</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;per 
barrel was </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">15</font><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;per cent </font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">higher</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">&#32;than the same period in </font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">2013</font><font
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">. Although WTI has increased seven per 
cent during first six months of 2014 as compared to
 the first six months of 2013, the average differential between WTI and Edmonton
posted prices widened during the same periods in 2013 and 2014 from an average 
of US$5.26 to US$7.24, respectively. This widened differential was more than 
offset by the impact of the weakened value of the Canadian dollar in comparison 
to the US dollar, from an average of $1.02 in the first six months of 2013 to 
$1.10 in the first six months of 2014, which increased the Canadian dollar price
that ARC ultimately received for its oil.</font></div><div style="line-
height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;text-align:justify;font-size:9pt;"><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">Natural gas prices increased in the 
</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;text-
decoration:none;">second</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">&#32;quarter of </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">2014</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;as compared to </font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">2013</font><font
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;as natural gas inventory levels 
were lower following strong demand from a colder North American winter than in
the previous year. ARC's </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">second</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;quarter 2014 average realized price of 
</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">$4.99</font><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;per mcf was higher than the 
average AECO monthly index price during the same period due in part to ARC's 
higher than average heat content inherent in its natural gas. Additionally, ARC 
maintains a diversified sales portfolio that allows some flexibility on a 
portion of its natural gas sales between monthly average and daily spot pricing 
at sales hubs in western Canada and the mid-western United 
States.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;text-
align:justify;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">During the </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">six 
months ended</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">June 30, 
2014</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">, ARC's average 
realized natural gas price of </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">$5.28</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;per 
mcf </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">increase</font><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">d by </font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">45</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">&#32;per cent over the same period of the prior year and reflects the
</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">41</font><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;per cent </font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">increase</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">&#32;in the average AECO monthly posting in </font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">2014</font><font
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;as compared to </font><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">2013</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-

basis, is weighted more heavily to natural gas than to oil, ARC's revenue 
contribution is more heavily weighted to crude oil and liquids production as

size:8pt;">100</font></div></td></tr></table></div></div><a 
name="sE7135A5F7F8A88DB5593B4AA3CFAF976"></a><div style="line-
height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;text-align:justify;font-size:9pt;"><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;font-weight:bold;text-
decoration:none;">Risk Management</font></div><div style="line-
height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;text-align:justify;font-size:9pt;"><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">ARC maintains a risk management program
to reduce the volatility of revenues, increase the certainty of funds from 
operations, and to protect acquisition and development economics. ARC&#8217;s 
risk management program is governed by certain guidelines approved by the Board 
of Directors (the "Board"). These guidelines currently restrict the amount of 
risk management contract volumes to a maximum of 55 per cent of total forecast 
production over the next two years with a maximum of 25 per cent of forecast 
natural gas production in risk management contracts beyond two years and up to 
five years. ARC&#8217;s risk management program guidelines allow for further 
risk management contracts on anticipated volumes associated with new production 
arising from specific capital projects and acquisitions or to further protect 
cash flows for a specific period with approval of the Board.</font></div><div 
style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;text-align:justify;font-
size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">Gains and losses on 
risk management contracts are composed of both realized gains and losses 
representing the portion of risk management contracts that have settled in cash 
during the period and unrealized gains or losses that represent the change in 
the mark-to-market position of those contracts throughout the period. ARC does 
not employ hedge accounting for its risk management contracts currently in 
place. ARC considers all of its risk management contracts to be effective 
economic hedges of its underlying business 
transactions.</font></div><br><div><div style="line-height:120%;text-
align:center;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-
size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-
align:center;font-size:10pt;"><div style="padding-left:0px;text-indent:0px;line-
height:normal;padding-top:10px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" 
style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;margin-left:auto;margin-

style="vertical-align:bottom;border-bottom:1px solid #000000;padding-

period.</font></div></td></tr></table><div style="line-height:120%;padding-

family:Arial;font-size:8pt;text-transform:default;">ARC enters into certain

spanning the entire calendar year but that are settled at the end of the year on
an annual average benchmark commodity 
price.</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" 
style="padding-bottom:10px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td

in fair value of the contracts during the 
period.</font></div></td></tr></table><div style="line-height:120%;padding-
bottom:10px;text-align:justify;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">During the </font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;text-
decoration:none;">second</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">&#32;quarter of </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">2014</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">, ARC recorded a </font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">loss</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">&#32;of </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">$10.6 
million</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;on its risk 
management contracts comprising realized </font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">losses</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">&#32;of </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">$25.4 
million</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;and unrealized
</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">gains</font><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;of </font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">$14.8 million</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">. The realized losses related to crude oil, natural
gas, foreign exchange and electricity contracts.</font></div><div style="line-
height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;text-align:justify;font-size:9pt;"><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">For the </font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">six months ended</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">June 30, 2014</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">, 
ARC has recognized a </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">loss</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;on its
risk management contracts of </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">$120 million</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">&#32;comprising a realized </font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">loss</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">&#32;of </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">$45.6 
million</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;and an 
unrealized </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">loss</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;of 
</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">$74.4 million</font><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">. The realized losses are related to 
crude oil, natural gas, foreign exchange and electricity contracts and represent
cash payments made by ARC during the period. ARC's net unrealized </font><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">losses</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;related
 primarily to natural gas contracts with losses of $64.7 million. These losses 
were due to the increase in the value of the NYMEX forward curve over that time 
period.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;text-
align:justify;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">The
unrealized losses on crude oil contracts are largely attributed to contracts 
having ceiling prices averaging approximately US$100 per barrel throughout 2014.
At June 30, 2014, these positions had been marked-to-market at an average 
forward price of approximately US$102.36 per barrel compared to a December 31, 
2013 average forward price of US$92.76 per barrel.</font></div><div style="line-
height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;text-align:justify;font-size:9pt;"><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">ARC&#8217;s risk management contracts
provide protection from natural gas prices falling lower than an average floor 
price of US</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;color:#000000;font-style:normal;font-weight:normal;text-
decoration:none;">$4.03</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">&#32;per mmbtu on approximately </font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;font-style:normal;font-
weight:normal;text-decoration:none;">240,000</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;mmbtu per day for the remainder of 2014. In 
addition, they provide upside participation to a price of US</font><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;text-
decoration:none;">$4.17</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">&#32;per mmbtu on approximately </font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;text-
decoration:none;">240,000</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">&#32;mmbtu per day for the remainder of 2014. ARC has also executed 
long-term natural gas hedge contracts on 165,000 mmbtu per day for 2015, 100,000
mmbtu per day for the period 2016 through 2017, and 50,000 mmbtu per day for 
2018. ARC currently has hedged approximately </font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">60</font><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;per cent of total forecast natural
gas production for the remainder of 2014.</font></div><br><div><div style="line-
height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-
family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-
height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:10pt;"><div style="padding-
left:0px;text-indent:0px;line-height:normal;padding-top:10px;"><table 
cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-
size:10pt;margin-left:auto;margin-right:auto;width:91.40625%;border-
collapse:collapse;text-align:left;"><tr><td colspan="3"></td></tr><tr><td 
width="34%"></td><td width="33%"></td><td width="33%"></td></tr><tr><td 
colspan="2" style="vertical-align:bottom;padding-left:2px;padding-
top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;border-top:1px solid #000000;"><div
style="text-align:left;font-size:7pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:7pt;">ARC Resources Ltd.</font></div></td><td style="vertical-
align:bottom;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-
right:2px;border-top:1px solid #000000;"><div style="text-align:right;font-
size:7pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:7pt;">Page 
13</font></div></td></tr></table></div></div></div><hr style="page-break-
after:always"><div></div><br><div style="line-height:120%;padding-
bottom:10px;text-align:justify;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">ARC also has AECO basis swap contracts in place, 
fixing the AECO price received to approximately 90 per cent of the Henry Hub 
NYMEX price on a portion of its natural gas volume throughout 2014 and into 
2019. As at </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">June 30, 2014</font><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">, the net fair value of these basis 
swap contracts was an asset of $19.5 million.</font></div><div style="line-
height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;text-align:justify;font-size:9pt;"><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">Given the significant contribution of 
ARC&#8217;s crude oil, condensate and NGLs production to total sales revenue and
funds from operations, ARC management also recognizes the risk associated with a
reduction in crude oil pricing. Accordingly, ARC has protected the selling price
on a portion of crude oil production by establishing crude oil floor and ceiling
prices for 2014 with approximately </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">45</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;per cent of total forecast crude oil and 
condensate production being hedged for the remainder of 2014 at floor prices of 
US</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;text-
decoration:none;">$90</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">&#32;per barrel. These contracts allow ARC to participate in crude 
oil prices up to approximately US</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">$100</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;per barrel on approximately </font><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;text-
decoration:none;">18,000</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">&#32;barrels per day for the remainder of 2014.</font></div><div 
style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;text-align:justify;font-
size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;font-
weight:normal;text-decoration:none;">Table 16</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;summarizes ARC&#8217;s average crude oil and 
natural gas hedged volumes for 2014 through 2019 as at the date of this 
MD&amp;A. For a complete listing and terms of ARC&#8217;s hedging contracts at 
</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;text-
decoration:none;">June 30, 2014</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">, see </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">Note 8</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;&#8220;</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">Financial 
Instruments and Market Risk Management</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#8221; in the financial statements as at and for 
the </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">three and six months 
ended</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;</font><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">June 30, 2014</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">. Updates to the following table are posted to 
ARC&#8217;s website at </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;text-
decoration:underline;">www.arcresources.com</font><font style="font-

cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-family:Times New Roman; font-
size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:18px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td 
style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:8pt;padding-
left:0px;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:8pt;">(1)</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div 
style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:8pt;"><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:8pt;">The prices and volumes in this table represent 
averages for several contracts representing different periods. The average price
for the portfolio of options listed above does not have the same payoff profile 
as the individual option contracts. Viewing the average price of a group of 
options is purely for indicative purposes. All positions are financially settled
against the benchmark prices disclosed in Note 8 &#8220;Financial Instruments 
and Market Risk Management&#8221; in the financial statements for the three and 
six months ended June 30, 2014.</font></div></td></tr></table><table 
cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-family:Times New Roman; font-
size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:18px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td 
style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:8pt;padding-
left:0px;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:8pt;">(2)</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div 
style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:8pt;"><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:8pt;">The crude oil prices in this table are referenced 
to WTI. For 2014, all floor positions settle against the monthly average WTI 
price. Positions establishing the &#8220;ceiling&#8221; have been sold against 
the monthly average WTI price.</font></div></td></tr></table><table 
cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-family:Times New Roman; font-
size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:18px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td 
style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:8pt;padding-
left:0px;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:8pt;">(3)</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div 
style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:8pt;"><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:8pt;">The natural gas prices in this table are referenced
to NYMEX at Henry Hub.</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" 
cellspacing="0" style="padding-bottom:10px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-
size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:18px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td 
style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:8pt;padding-
left:0px;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:8pt;">(4)</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div 
style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:8pt;"><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:8pt;">ARC sells the majority of its natural gas 
production based on AECO pricing. To reduce the risk of weak basis pricing (AECO
relative to NYMEX) ARC has hedged a portion of production by tying ARC's price 
to a percentage of the NYMEX natural gas 
price.</font></div></td></tr></table><div style="line-height:120%;padding-
bottom:10px;text-align:justify;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#8220;Floors&#8221; represent the lower price 
limits on hedged volumes and consist of put and swap prices. 
&#8220;Ceilings&#8221; provide an upper limit to the prices ARC may receive for 
hedged volumes and are the result of combined call and swap prices. ARC has also
sold puts that limit the downside protection at an average of the disclosed 
&#8220;Sold Floor&#8221; price. These &#8220;Sold Floors&#8221; do not eliminate
the floor, but merely limit the downside protection. The purpose of transacting 
these sold puts is to reduce ARC&#8217;s overall hedging transaction 
costs.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;text-
align:justify;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">To 
accurately analyze ARC&#8217;s hedge position, contracts need to be modeled 
separately as using average prices and volumes may be misleading. The following 
provides examples of how </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;color:#000000;font-style:normal;font-weight:normal;text-
decoration:none;">Table 16</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">&#32;can be interpreted for approximate current year values (all in 
US dollars):</font></div><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-
bottom:10px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td 
style="width:48px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div 
style="line-height:120%;font-size:9pt;padding-left:24px;"><font style="font-

above </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;text-
decoration:none;">$100.00</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">&#32;per barrel, ARC will receive </font><font style="font-

on </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;text-
decoration:none;">18,000</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">&#32;barrels per day.</font></div></td></tr></table><br><div><div
