style="line-height:120%;font-size:9pt;padding-left:24px;"><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-
align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-
size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">If the market price is
below </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;text-
decoration:none;">$70.00</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">&#32;per barrel, ARC will receive </font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;text-
decoration:none;">$90.00</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">&#32;per barrel less the difference between </font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;text-
decoration:none;">$70.00</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">&#32;per barrel and the market price on </font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;text-
decoration:none;">5,000</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">&#32;barrels per day. For example, if the market price is at 
</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;text-
decoration:none;">$55.00</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">&#32;per barrel, ARC will receive </font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;text-
decoration:none;">$75.00</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">&#32;per barrel on </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">5,000</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;barrels per day and </font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;text-
decoration:none;">$90.00</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">&#32;per barrel on </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">13,000</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;barrels per 
day.</font></div></td></tr></table><div style="line-height:120%;padding-
bottom:10px;text-align:justify;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">The net fair value of ARC&#8217;s risk management 
contracts at </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">June 30, 2014</font><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;was </font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">a net 
liability</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;of 
</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;text-
decoration:none;">$22.1 million</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">, representing the expected market price to buy out ARC&#8217;s 
contracts at the balance sheet date after any adjustments for credit risk. This 
may differ from what will eventually be settled in future 
periods.</font></div><a name="sC94DBE122361D57F1245B4AA42B4DF93"></a><div 
style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;text-align:left;font-
size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-
weight:bold;">Operating Netbacks</font></div><div style="line-
height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;text-align:justify;font-size:9pt;"><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">ARC&#8217;s operating netback prior to 
hedging was </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">$37.41</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;per boe in the </font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;text-
decoration:none;">second</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">&#32;quarter of </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">2014</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;(</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">$38.02</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;for 
the </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">six months 
ended</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;</font><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">June 30, 2014</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">) as compared to </font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;text-
decoration:none;">$28.11</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">&#32;per boe in the same period of </font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">2013</font><font
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;(</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">$28.22</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">&#32;for the </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">six months ended</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">June 30, 
2013</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">).</font></div><div 
style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;text-align:justify;font-
size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">ARC&#8217;s 2014 
</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;text-
decoration:none;">second</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">&#32;quarter and year-to-date netbacks, including realized hedging 
gains and losses, were </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">$34.88</font><font style="font-

family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">increase</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">s of </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">23</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;per cent and </font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">25</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-

style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;text-

left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;border-top:1px solid #000000;"><div 
style="text-align:right;font-size:8pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-

family:Arial;font-size:8pt;font-weight:bold;">100</font></div></td><td 
style="vertical-align:bottom;border-bottom:2px solid #000000;border-right:1px 
solid #000000;"><div
 style="text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-
size:10pt;"><br></font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:bottom;border-
bottom:2px solid #000000;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-
bottom:2px;border-left:1px solid #000000;"><div style="text-align:right;font-
size:8pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:8pt;">100</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:bottom;border-
bottom:2px solid #000000;"><div style="text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><font 
style="font-family:inherit;font-
size:10pt;"><br></font></div></td></tr></table></div></div><table 
cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-family:Times New Roman; font-
size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:18px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td 
style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:8pt;padding-
left:0px;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:8pt;">(1)</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div 
style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:8pt;"><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:8pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">Non-GAAP measure
which may not be comparable to similar non-GAAP measures used by other entities.
Refer to the section entitled "Non-GAAP Measures" contained within this 
MD&amp;A.</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" 
style="font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td 
style="width:18px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div 
style="line-height:120%;font-size:8pt;padding-left:0px;"><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:8pt;">(2)</font></div></td><td style="vertical-
align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-
size:8pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;">Composed of direct 
costs incurred to operate oil and gas wells. A number of assumptions have been 
made in allocating these costs between crude oil, heavy oil, condensate, natural
gas and NGLs production.</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" 
cellspacing="0" style="padding-bottom:10px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-
size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:18px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td 
style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:8pt;padding-
left:0px;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:8pt;">(3)</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div 
style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:8pt;"><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:8pt;">Includes realized cash gains and losses on risk 
management contracts. </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;">In
the first and second quarters of 2013, realized gains on foreign exchange 
contracts were not included in the netback calculation as they related solely to
debt.</font></div></td></tr></table><div style="line-height:120%;font-
size:8pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;"><br></font></div><a 
name="s2A0F9072F3A3164EE5ECB4AA4746153D"></a><div style="line-
height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;text-align:justify;font-size:9pt;"><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-
weight:bold;">Royalties</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-
bottom:10px;text-align:justify;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">ARC pays royalties to the respective provincial 
governments and landowners of the four western Canadian provinces in which it 
operates. Approximately </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">85</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;per cent
of these royalties are Crown royalties. Each province that ARC operates in has 
established a separate and distinct royalty regime which impacts ARC&#8217;s 
average corporate royalty rate.</font></div><div style="line-
height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;text-align:justify;font-size:9pt;"><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">In British Columbia, the majority of 
ARC&#8217;s royalty expense stems from production of natural gas and associated 
liquids. While condensate and NGLs have a flat royalty rate of 20 per cent of 
sales revenue, the royalty rates for natural gas are based on the drill date of 
a well and a reference price. In Alberta, the majority of ARC&#8217;s royalties 
are related to oil production where royalty rates are based on reference prices,
production levels and well depths. Similarly, most royalties remitted in 
Saskatchewan and Manitoba relate to oil production. Royalty calculations in 
these provinces are based on the classification of the oil product and well 
productivity.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;text-
align:justify;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">Each province has various incentive programs in place to promote 
drilling by reducing the overall royalty expense for producers and offsetting 
gathering and processing costs. In most cases, the incentive period lasts for a 
finite period of time (usually 12 months upon commencement of production), after
which point the royalty rate usually increases depending on the production rate 
of the well and prevailing market commodity prices.</font></div><div 
style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;text-align:justify;font-
size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">In the first quarter 
of 2013, the British Columbia government announced a three per cent minimum 
royalty for all natural gas wells that qualify for the Deep Well Royalty Credit 
as well as the termination of the Summer Drilling Credit Program. These changes 
were effective April 1, 2013 and had a minimal impact on natural gas royalties 
for the balance of 2013. During the first quarter of 2014, the provincial 
government of British Columbia announced further changes to its royalty program,
whereby the three per cent minimum royalty was replaced by a six per cent 
minimum and additional royalty credits will be made available for horizontal 
wells drilled to depths greater than 1,900 meters. These changes apply to wells 
spud on or after April 1, 2014. ARC expects that it should be able to leverage 
these newly announced credits in its future drilling in northern British 
Columbia.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;text-
align:justify;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">Total royalties as a percentage of pre-hedged commodity product sales
revenue </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">decrease</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">d from 
</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">14.8</font><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;per cent (</font><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">$7.01</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;per boe) in the </font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;text-
decoration:none;">second</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">&#32;quarter of </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">2013</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;to </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">14.2</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;per 
cent (</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">$8.02</font><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;per boe) in the </font><font
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;text-
decoration:none;">second</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">&#32;quarter of </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">2014</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">, reflecting increased natural gas drilling 
eligible to receive provincial drilling credits as well as an increased 
proportion of NGLs production coming from British Columbia where the NGLs 
royalty rate is lower than in Alberta as compared to the prior year. Total 
royalties increased from </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">$59.6 million</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">&#32;in the </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">second</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;quarter of </font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">2013</font><font
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;to </font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">$80.4 million</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;in the </font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;text-
decoration:none;">second</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">&#32;quarter of </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">2014</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;due to increased production. For the 
</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">six months 
ended</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;</font><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">June 30, 2014</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">, total royalties represented </font><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">14.3</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;per cent of pre-hedged commodity product sales
(</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">$8.21</font><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;per boe) as compared to 
</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">13.8</font><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;per cent (</font><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">$6.31</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;per boe) for the same period in </font><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;text-
decoration:none;">2013</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">. 
</font></div><br><div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-
size:10pt;"><font
 style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-
height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:10pt;"><div style="padding-
left:0px;text-indent:0px;line-height:normal;padding-top:10px;"><table 
cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-
size:10pt;margin-left:auto;margin-right:auto;width:91.40625%;border-
collapse:collapse;text-align:left;"><tr><td colspan="3"></td></tr><tr><td 
width="34%"></td><td width="33%"></td><td width="33%"></td></tr><tr><td 
colspan="2" style="vertical-align:bottom;padding-left:2px;padding-
top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;border-top:1px solid #000000;"><div
style="text-align:left;font-size:7pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:7pt;">ARC Resources Ltd.</font></div></td><td style="vertical-
align:bottom;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-
right:2px;border-top:1px solid #000000;"><div style="text-align:right;font-
size:7pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:7pt;">Page 
16</font></div></td></tr></table></div></div></div><hr style="page-break-
after:always"><div></div><br><div style="line-height:120%;padding-
bottom:10px;text-align:justify;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">The </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">increase</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;in
the royalty rate during the first </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">six</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;months 
of </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;text-
decoration:none;">2014</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">&#32;as compared to the same period of the prior year reflects the 
increase in commodity prices over the same periods.</font></div><a 
name="s6B47ACD4855515ED771CB4AA47655E6B"></a><div style="line-
height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;text-align:justify;font-size:9pt;"><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;font-weight:bold;text-
decoration:none;">Operating and Transportation Expenses</font></div><div 
style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;text-align:justify;font-
size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">Operating expenses 
</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">decrease</font><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">d to </font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;text-
decoration:none;">$9.11</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">&#32;per boe in the </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">second</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;quarter of </font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">2014</font><font
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;compared to </font><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;text-
decoration:none;">$10.29</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">&#32;per boe in the </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">second</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;quarter of </font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">2013</font><font
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">. On a full dollar basis, operating 
expenses have </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">increase</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">d by 
</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">$3.8 million</font><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;or </font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">four</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">&#32;per cent for the </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">second</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;quarter of </font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">2014</font><font
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;as compared to the </font><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;text-
decoration:none;">second</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">&#32;quarter of </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">2013</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">. In the second quarter of the prior year, 
operating costs were impacted by very high electricity costs due to average 
quarterly electricity rates of $123.36 per megawatt hour. In 2014, the second 
quarter average electricity rate was 66 per cent lower at $42.30 per megawatt 
hour. On a per boe basis, ARC's operating costs were lower for the second 
quarter of 2013 compared to the second quarter of 2014 as additional production 
volumes were brought on from new wells having a lower average cost structure. 
For the </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">six months 
ended</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;</font><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">June 30, 2014</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">, operating expenses </font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">decrease</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">d by </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">$0.45</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;per 
boe, also as a result of increased production volumes from new wells with 
relatively lower operating costs.</font></div><div style="line-
height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;text-align:justify;font-size:9pt;"><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">ARC hedges a portion of its electricity
costs using financial risk management contracts that do not qualify for hedge 
accounting. The gains and losses associated with these contracts are included 
within gains and losses on risk management contracts on the condensed interim 
consolidated statements of income (the "statements of income"). Had these 
contracts been recognized within operating expenses, ARC&#8217;s operating 
expenses would have been </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">increase</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">d by 
</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">$0.08</font><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;per boe for the three months ended
</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">June 30, 2014</font><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;(</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">increase</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">d </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">$0.07</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;per 
boe for the </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">six months 
ended</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;</font><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">June 30, 2014</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">) as a result of a realized </font><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">loss</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;of </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">$0.8 million</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">&#32;during the period (realized </font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">loss</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">&#32;of </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">$1.4 
million</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;for the 
</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">six months 
ended</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;</font><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">June 30, 2014</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">).</font></div><div style="line-
height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;text-align:justify;font-size:9pt;"><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">Transportation expense was </font><font
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;text-
decoration:none;">$2.02</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">&#32;per boe during the </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">second</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;quarter of </font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">2014</font><font
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;(</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">$1.97</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">&#32;per boe for the </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">six months ended</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">June 30, 
2014</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">) as compared to 
</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;text-
decoration:none;">$2.04</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">&#32;per boe in the </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">second</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;quarter of </font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">2013</font><font
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;(</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">$1.72</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">&#32;per boe for the </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">six months ended</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">June 30, 
2013</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">). ARC chooses to 
control its own transportation arrangements in order to move its product most 
efficiently to market. Generally
 this results in bearing additional transport costs, but in most cases is offset
by higher revenue received for its products. As this transformation has taken 
place over the past two years, ARC's transportation expenses per barrel have 
been increasing. Additionally, with the current situation of many crude oil and 
liquids pipelines being at or near capacity, ARC has incurred additional 
transportation expenses throughout 2013 and into 2014 as it has been necessary 
to use additional methods of transport to get its production to 
market.</font></div><a name="sB4A67943B75690BED47FB4AA4794BC1F"></a><div 
style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;text-align:justify;font-
size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-
weight:bold;">G&amp;A Expenses and Long-Term Incentive 
Compensation</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;text-
align:justify;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">G&amp;A, prior to long-term incentive compensation expense and net of
capitalized G&amp;A and overhead recoveries on operated properties, </font><font
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">decrease</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">d by </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">11</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;per cent
to </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">$14.1 
million</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;in the 
</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;text-
decoration:none;">second</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">&#32;quarter of </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">2014</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;from </font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">$15.9 million</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;in the </font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;text-
decoration:none;">second</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">&#32;quarter of </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">2013</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">. </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">Second</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">&#32;quarter </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">2014</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;G&amp;A expenses </font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">decrease</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">d as compared to the </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">second</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;quarter of </font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">2013</font><font
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;as a result of increased capital 
spending that led to additional capitalized G&amp;A and increased recoveries 
from ARC's partners.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-
bottom:10px;text-align:justify;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">For the </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">six months ended</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">June 30, 
2014</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">, ARC's G&amp;A, prior
to long-term compensation expense and net of capitalized G&amp;A and overhead 
recoveries on operated properties, was </font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">$29.5 million</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">, a </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">$1.2 million</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">decrease</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">&#32;from the same period in </font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">2013</font><font
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">, also reflecting increased capitalized
G&amp;A and recoveries from partners associated with capital 
spending.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;text-
align:justify;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">Table 18</font><font style="font-

cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-bottom:10px;font-family:Times New

style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:8pt;padding-
left:0px;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:8pt;">(2)</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div 
style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:8pt;"><font style="font-

and Stock Option Plans.</font></div></td></tr></table><br><div><div style="line-

family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-
height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:10pt;"><div style="padding-
left:0px;text-indent:0px;line-height:normal;padding-top:10px;"><table 
cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-family:Times
 New Roman;font-size:10pt;margin-left:auto;margin-
right:auto;width:91.40625%;border-collapse:collapse;text-align:left;"><tr><td 
colspan="3"></td></tr><tr><td width="34%"></td><td width="33%"></td><td 
width="33%"></td></tr><tr><td colspan="2" style="vertical-align:bottom;padding-
left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;border-top:1px 
solid #000000;"><div style="text-align:left;font-size:7pt;"><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:7pt;">ARC Resources Ltd.</font></div></td><td 
style="vertical-align:bottom;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-
bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;border-top:1px solid #000000;"><div style="text-
align:right;font-size:7pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:7pt;">Page 
17</font></div></td></tr></table></div></div></div><hr style="page-break-
after:always"><a 
name="s452F4DAF3561B2551A3FB4AA47B3DA8D"></a><div></div><br><div style="line-
height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;text-align:left;font-size:9pt;"><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;font-weight:bold;text-
decoration:none;">Long-Term Incentive Plans &#8211; Restricted Share Unit &amp; 
Performance Share Unit Plan, Share Option Plan, and Deferred Share Unit 
Plan</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-
weight:bold;">&#32;</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-
bottom:10px;text-align:justify;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-weight:bold;">Restricted Share Unit and 
Performance Share Unit Plan</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-
bottom:10px;text-align:justify;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">The RSU and PSU Plan is designed to offer each 
eligible employee and officer (the &#8220;plan participants&#8221;) cash 
compensation in relation to the underlying value of a specified number of share 
units. The RSU and PSU Plan consists of RSUs for which the number of units is 
fixed and will vest over a period of three years and PSUs for which the number 
of units is variable and will vest at the end of three years.</font></div><div 
style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;text-align:justify;font-
size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">Upon vesting, the plan
participant is entitled to receive a cash payment based on the underlying value 
of the share units plus accrued dividends. The cash compensation issued upon 
vesting of the PSUs is dependent upon the total return performance of ARC 
compared to its peers. Total return is calculated as a sum of the change in the 
market price of the common shares in the period plus the amount of dividends in 
the period. A performance multiplier is applied to the PSUs based on the 
percentile rank of ARC&#8217;s total shareholder return compared to its peers. 
The performance multiplier ranges from zero if ARC&#8217;s performance ranks in 
the bottom quartile, to two for top quartile performance.</font></div><div 
style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;text-align:justify;font-
size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">ARC recorded G&amp;A 
expenses of </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">$4.4 
million</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;during the 
</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;text-
decoration:none;">second</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">&#32;quarter of </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">2014</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;in accordance with the RSU and PSU Plan, as 
compared to </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">$6.1 
million</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;during the 
</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;text-
decoration:none;">second</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">&#32;quarter of </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">2013</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">. For the </font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">six months ended</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">June 30, 2014</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">, 
ARC recorded expenses related to the RSU and PSU Plan of </font><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">$8.3 million</font><font style="font-
family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">,</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">&#32;a </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;color:#000000;font-style:normal;font-weight:normal;text-
decoration:none;">decrease</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">&#32;of </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">$11.5 
million</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;or 
</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">58</font><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;per cent from the </font><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">six 
months ended</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">June 30, 2013</font><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">. The decreases for both the second 
quarter of 2014 as compared to the second quarter of 2013 and the six months 
ended June 30, 2014 as compared to the six months ended June 30, 2013 are 
related to a reduction in the performance multiplier used to determine the 
compensation cost associated with the PSU awards. During the first and second 
quarters of 2014, the total shareholder return of many of ARC's peers increased 
significantly, while ARC's total shareholder return increased by a more moderate
amount. This reduction is partially offset by an increase in ARC's share price 
from a closing price of $29.57 at December&#160;31, 2013 to $32.49 at June 30, 
2014, which served to increase the value of accrued awards.</font></div><div 
style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;text-align:justify;font-
size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">During the 
</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;text-
decoration:none;">six months ended</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">June 30, 2014</font><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">, ARC made cash payments of 
</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;text-
decoration:none;">$17.3 million</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">&#32;in respect of the RSU and PSU Plan (</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">$15.7 
million</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;for the 
</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;text-
decoration:none;">six months ended</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">June 30, 2013</font><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">). Of these payments, </font><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;text-
decoration:none;">$12.6 million</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">&#32;were in respect of amounts recorded to G&amp;A expenses 
(</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;text-
decoration:none;">$11.6 million</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">&#32;for the </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">six months ended</font><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">June 30, 
2013</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">) and </font><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">$4.7
million</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;were in 
respect of amounts recorded to operating expenses and capitalized as PP&amp;E 
and E&amp;E assets (</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">$4.1 million</font><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;for the </font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">six months 
ended</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;</font><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">June
30, 2013</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">). These amounts 
were accrued in prior periods.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-
bottom:10px;text-align:left;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">Table 19</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;shows the changes to the RSU and PSU Plan 
during </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;text-
decoration:none;">2014</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">:</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;font-
size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;font-
weight:bold;text-decoration:none;">Table 19</font><div style="padding-
left:0px;text-indent:0px;line-height:normal;padding-top:10px;"><table 
cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-
size:10pt;width:100%;border-collapse:collapse;text-align:left;"><tr><td 
colspan="4"></td></tr><tr><td width="46%"></td><td width="18%"></td><td 
width="18%"></td><td width="18%"></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-

 style="text-align:left;font-size:8pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-

style="vertical-align:bottom;border-bottom:1px solid #000000;padding-

family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">The liability associated with the RSUs and PSUs 
granted is recognized in the statements of income over the vesting period while 
being adjusted each period for changes in the underlying share price, accrued 
dividends and the number of PSUs expected to be issued on vesting. In periods 
where substantial share price fluctuation occurs, ARC&#8217;s G&amp;A expenses 
are subject to significant volatility.</font></div><br><div><div style="line-

common shares plus accrued dividends.</font></div></td></tr></table><a 
name="s03DF080D891805A9C439B4AA47F2D3F6"></a><div style="line-
height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;text-align:justify;font-size:9pt;"><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-weight:bold;">Share Option 
Plan</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;text-
align:justify;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">Share options are granted to employees and consultants of ARC, 
vesting evenly on the fourth and fifth anniversaries of their respective grant 
dates, and have a maximum term of seven years. The option holder has the right 
to exercise the options at the original exercise price or at a reduced exercise 
price, equal to the exercise price at grant date less all dividends paid 
subsequent to the grant date and prior to the exercise date. On June 19, 2014, 
ARC granted 568,538 options to officers and certain employees at 
ARC.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;text-
align:justify;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">At 
</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;text-
decoration:none;">June 30, 2014</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">, ARC had </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">2.6 million</font><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;share options outstanding under 
this plan, representing less than one per cent of outstanding shares, with a 
weighted average exercise price of </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">$24.04</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;per share. Compensation expense of 
</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">$0.5 million</font><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;has been recorded during the 
</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">second</font><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;quarter of </font><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">2014</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;(</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">$1.1 million</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">&#32;for the </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">six months ended</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">June 30, 
2014</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">) compared to 
</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">$0.3 million</font><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;for the </font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">second</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">&#32;quarter of </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-

(</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">$0.7 million</font><font

size:9pt;">June 30, 2013</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">),
and is included within G&amp;A expenses.</font></div><a 
name="sA6C0430014812AA437FFB4AA48116BD7"></a><div style="line-
height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;text-align:justify;font-size:9pt;"><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-weight:bold;">Deferred Share Unit 
Plan</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;text-
align:justify;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">ARC
has a DSU Plan for its non-employee directors under which each director receives
a minimum of 55 per cent of their total annual remuneration in the form of DSUs.
Each DSU fully vests on the date of grant but is settled in cash only when the 
director has ceased to be a member of the Board. For the </font><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">three and six</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;months ended </font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">June 30, 2014</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">, G&amp;A expenses of </font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">$0.7 million</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;and </font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">$1.3 
million</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;were recorded 
in relation to the DSU Plan (</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">$0.6 million</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">&#32;and </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">$1.3 million</font><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;in </font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">2013</font><font
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">).</font></div><a 
name="sAF118E2E93A3B7E5527BB4AA4840B8F0"></a><div style="line-
height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;text-align:left;font-size:9pt;"><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-weight:bold;">Interest and Financing
Charges</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;text-
align:justify;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">Interest and financing charges </font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">increase</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">d </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">nine</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;per 
cent to </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">$11.2 
million</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;in the 
</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;text-
decoration:none;">second</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">&#32;quarter of </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">2014</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;from </font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">$10.3 million</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;in the </font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;text-
decoration:none;">second</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">&#32;quarter of </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">2013</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">. For the </font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">six months ended</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">June 30, 2014</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">, 
interest and financing charges were </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">$23.2 million</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">&#32;as compared to </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">$20.6 million</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">&#32;in </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">2013</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">, </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">an increase</font><font
 style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;of </font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">13</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">&#32;per cent. The increase in interest charges reflects the higher
average debt level held by ARC during the first and second quarters of 2014 as 
compared to the first and second quarters of 2013. Debt levels were lower in the
first six months of 2013 following an equity offering completed during the 
latter half of 2012 which served to finance a portion of ARC's 2013 capital 
program.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;text-
align:justify;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">At 
</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;text-
decoration:none;">June 30, 2014</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-

style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;of long-term debt outstanding, 
including a current portion of </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">$46 million</font><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;that is due for repayment within 
the next 12 months. Of the total debt balance, </font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">$765.9 million</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;is fixed at a weighted average 
</font></div><br><div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-

style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;per cent, while the remaining 
</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">$137.8 million</font><font

based on market rates plus a current credit spread of 150 basis points. 
Approximately </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">79</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;per cent (US</font><font style="font-

million</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">) of ARC&#8217;s 
debt outstanding is denominated in US dollars.</font></div><a 
name="s932E681BEB79A0DD7EE0B4AA4073D725"></a><div style="line-
height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;text-align:justify;font-size:9pt;"><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-weight:bold;">Foreign Exchange Gains
and Losses</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;text-
align:justify;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">ARC
recorded a foreign exchange </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">gain</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;of 
</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">$25.4 million</font><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;in the </font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;text-
decoration:none;">second</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">&#32;quarter of </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">2014</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;compared to a </font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">loss</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">&#32;of </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">$25.2 
million</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;in the
</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;text-
decoration:none;">second</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">&#32;quarter of </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">2013</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">. The </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">gain</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;is 
primarily a result of the revaluation of ARC&#8217;s US dollar denominated debt 
outstanding from the period of </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">March&#160;31, 2014</font><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;to </font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">June 30, 
2014</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;and reflects the 
change in value of the US dollar relative to the Canadian dollar from 
</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;text-
decoration:none;">$1.1053</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">&#32;to </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">$1.0676</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-
bottom:10px;text-align:justify;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">For the </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">six months ended</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">June 30, 
2014</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">, ARC recorded a 
foreign exchange </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">loss</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;of 
</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">$3.6 million</font><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;compared to a </font><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">loss</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;of </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">$40.5 million</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">&#32;for the same period in the prior year. During the six months 
ended June 30, 2013, the value of the US dollar relative to the Canadian dollar 
increased from $0.9949 at December 31, 2012 to $1.0512 at June 30, 2013. On 
average, during the six months ended June 30, 2014, the value of the US dollar 
relative to the Canadian dollar has remained relatively flat, from </font><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">$1.0636</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;at </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">December&#160;31, 2013</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">&#32;to </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">$1.0676</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;at 
</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;text-
decoration:none;">June 30, 2014</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">&#32;resulting in less of an impact on the value of ARC's US dollar 
denominated debt.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-
bottom:10px;text-align:justify;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">Table 
21</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;shows the various 
components of foreign exchange losses:</font></div><div style="line-

family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">). The increases in current taxes for both the 
second quarter and the first six months of 2014 compared to the same periods in 
2013 reflect higher expected taxable income related to increased commodity 
prices and production volumes.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-
bottom:10px;text-align:justify;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-

million</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;was recorded 
(</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">$15 million</font><font

style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">June 30, 2013</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">). For both the three and six months ended June 30,
2014 as compared to the three and six months ended June 30, 2013, 
ARC</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:9pt;">&#8217;</font><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">s decrease in deferred tax expense is 
related primarily to increased unrealized losses on risk management contracts 
and a net increase in the ARO liability, partially offset by temporary 
differences arising from the book basis of ARC's PP&amp;E relative to its tax 
basis.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;text-
align:justify;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">The
income tax pools (detailed in </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">Table 22</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">) are deductible at various rates and annual 
deductions associated with the initial tax pools will decline over 
time.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;font-
size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;font-
weight:bold;text-decoration:none;">Table 22</font></div><div style="line-

name="sC1A42B8A8DDF9B662234B4AA3E8F1E7D"></a><div></div><br><div style="line-
height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;text-align:left;font-size:9pt;"><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-weight:bold;">DD&amp;A Expense and 
Impairment Charges</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-
bottom:10px;text-align:justify;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">ARC records DD&amp;A expense on its PP&amp;E over 
the individual useful lives of the assets employing the unit of production 
method using proved plus probable reserves and associated estimated future 
development capital required for its oil and natural gas assets, and a straight-
line method for its corporate administrative assets. Assets in the E&amp;E phase
are not amortized. For the </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">three and six</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">&#32;months ended </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">June 30, 2014</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">, 
ARC recorded DD&amp;A expense of </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">$160.4 million</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">&#32;and </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">$310.2
million</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;as compared to
</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">$129.7 million</font><font
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;and </font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">$262.9 million</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;for </font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">three and six</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;months ended </font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">June 30, 2013</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">, reflecting increased production volumes as well 
as increased capital spending on infrastructure as ARC continues to develop its 
own infrastructure to facilitate production in high-growth 
areas.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;text-
align:justify;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">A 
breakdown of DD&amp;A expense is summarized in </font><font style="font-

style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;font-weight:bold;text-
decoration:none;">Capital Expenditures, Acquisitions and 
Dispositions</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;text-
align:justify;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">Capital expenditures before acquisitions, dispositions or purchases 
of undeveloped land totaled </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">$236.1 million</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">&#32;in the </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">second</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;quarter of </font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">2014</font><font
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;as compared to </font><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">$170.7 million</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;during the </font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;text-
decoration:none;">second</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">&#32;quarter of </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">2013</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">. This total includes development and production 
additions to PP&amp;E of </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">$227.8 million</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">&#32;and additions to E&amp;E assets of </font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">$8.3 million</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">. PP&amp;E expenditures include additions to oil 
and gas development and production assets and administrative assets. E&amp;E 
expenditures include asset additions in areas that have been determined by 
Management to be in the E&amp;E stage.</font></div><div style="line-
height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;text-align:justify;font-size:9pt;"><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">During the three and six months ended 
June 30, 2014, ARC spent approximately </font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;font-style:normal;font-
weight:normal;text-decoration:none;">$16.6 million</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;and </font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">$22.4 million</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">, respectively, to acquire lands primarily in the 
northeastern British Columbia Montney and northern Alberta Montney regions. In 
the first quarter of 2014, ARC acquired a 20 mmcf per day processing facility 
and associated gathering system in the Alberta Montney region at Ante Creek 
where ARC holds an extensive land base.</font></div><div style="line-

from divestitures.</font></div></td></tr></table><div style="line-
height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;text-align:justify;font-size:9pt;"><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">In Q2 2014, ARC divested of certain 
non-core shallow gas assets located in southwestern Saskatchewan for gross 
proceeds of approximately $33 million. The divested properties had associated 
natural gas production of approximately 2,400 boe per day and 56 bcf of proved 
plus probable natural gas reserves. Proceeds from the divestment were used to 
further strengthen ARC's balance sheet.</font></div><div style="line-
height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;text-align:justify;font-size:9pt;"><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">ARC finances its capital expenditures 
with funds from operations that are available after deducting current period 
expenditures on site restoration and reclamation, net reclamation fund 
contributions, and dividends declared in the current period. Further funding is 
obtained by contributions from DRIP, SDP, and debt. ARC financed </font><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">92</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;per cent of the </font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">$252.7 million</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">second</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;quarter capital program with funds from 
operations and contributions from DRIP and SDP (</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">79</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">&#32;per cent in the </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">second</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;quarter of </font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">2013</font><font
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">).</font></div><div style="line-

style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:8pt;padding-

style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:8pt;"><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:8pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">Refer to the 
sections entitled "Funds from Operations" and &#8220;Additional GAAP 
Measures&#8221; contained within this MD&amp;A.</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:8pt;">&#32;The percentage of capital expenditures that 
have been funded by funds from operations is determined as funds from operations
that are available after deducting current period expenditures on site 
restoration and reclamation, net reclamation fund contributions, and dividends 
declared in the current period.</font></div></td></tr></table><a 
name="sD41C574CA72CAA1A8FCFB4AA490BB258"></a><div style="line-
height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;text-align:left;font-size:9pt;"><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-weight:bold;">Asset Retirement 
Obligations and Reclamation Fund</font></div><div style="line-
height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;text-align:justify;font-size:9pt;"><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">At </font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">June 30, 
2014</font><font
 style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">, ARC has recorded an ARO liability of
</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">$527.7 million</font><font
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;($</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">475.4 million</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;at </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">December&#160;31, 2013</font><font
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">) for the future abandonment and 
reclamation of ARC&#8217;s properties. The estimated ARO liability includes 
assumptions in respect of actual costs to abandon wells or reclaim the property,
the time frame in which such costs will be incurred, as well as annual inflation
factors in order to calculate the undiscounted total future liability. The 
future liability has been discounted at a liability-specific risk-free interest 
rate of </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;text-
decoration:none;">2.8</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">&#32;per cent (</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">3.2</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;per cent at </font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;text-
decoration:none;">December&#160;31, 2013</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">).</font></div><div style="line-
height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;text-align:justify;font-size:9pt;"><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">Accretion charges of </font><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">$3.7 million</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;and </font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">$7.6 
million</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;for the 
</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">three and six</font><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;months ended </font><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">June
30, 2014</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;(</font><font
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">$3.1 million</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;and </font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">$6.3 million</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;for </font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">2013</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">), respectively, have been recognized in the statements of income to 
reflect the increase in the ARO liability associated with the passage of 
time.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;text-
align:justify;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">Actual spending under ARC&#8217;s abandonment and reclamation program
for the </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">three and 
six</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;months ended 
</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;text-
decoration:none;">June 30, 2014</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">&#32;was </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">$3.1 
million</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;and 
$</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">6.3 million</font><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;(</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">$3.2 million</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;and </font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">$6.9 million</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;for </font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">2013</font><font
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">), respectively.</font></div><div 
style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;text-align:justify;font-
size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">In 2005, ARC 
established a restricted reclamation fund to finance obligations specifically 
associated with its Redwater property. Minimum contributions to this fund will 
be approximately </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">$66 million</font><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;in total over the next 
</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">42</font><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;years. The balance of this fund 
totaled </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;text-
decoration:none;">$32.8 million</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">&#32;at </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">June 30, 2014</font><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">, compared to </font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">$32.6 
million</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;at
</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;text-
decoration:none;">December&#160;31, 2013</font><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">. Under the terms of ARC&#8217;s investment policy,
cash in the reclamation fund can only be invested in Canadian or US Government 
securities, investment-grade corporate bonds, or investment-grade short-term 
money market securities.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-
bottom:10px;text-align:justify;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">Environmental stewardship is a core value at ARC 
and abandonment and reclamation activities continue to be made in a prudent, 
responsible manner with the oversight of the Health, Safety and Environment 
Committee of the Board. Ongoing abandonment expenditures for all of ARC&#8217;s 
assets including contributions to the Redwater reclamation fund are funded 
entirely out of funds from operations.</font></div><br><div><div style="line-
height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-
family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-

consolidated balance sheets (the "balance sheets"), and excludes current 
unrealized amounts pertaining to risk management contracts, assets held for sale
and ARO contained within liabilities associated with assets held for sale, as 
well as the current portion of long-term debt and current portion of 
ARO.</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0"

30, 2014</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">, ARC had total

size:9pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">$891.1 million</font><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">. ARC&#8217;s long-term debt balance 
includes a current portion of </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">$46 million</font><font 
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#32;at </font><font style="font-

size:9pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">December&#160;31, 2013</font><font
style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">), reflecting principal payments that 
are due to be paid within the next 12 months. ARC intends to finance these 
obligations by drawing on its syndicated credit facility at the time the 
payments are due.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-
bottom:10px;text-align:justify;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-
family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">ARC&#8217;s debt agreements contain a number of

2014</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">. These agreements are

size:9pt;">. ARC calculates its covenants four times annually. The major 
financial covenants are described below:</font></div><div style="line-
